newsitem.title: USA: Equitable says to buy Northeast Energy.
newsitem.headline: Equitable says to buy Northeast Energy.

text.p: Equitable Resources Inc said Monday it will acquire Northeast Energy Services Co for about $77 million in cash and stock.
The company said the $77 million value of the deal is based on the Friday, May 16 closing price of its common shares.
Equitable said the purchase, which it expects to be non-dilutive to its earnings, should close before the end of July.
Equitable said a portion of the financing for the deal will consist of shares purchased on the open market, as well as authorized and unissued common stock.
Equitable said it has 35.5 million shares outstanding.
The company said the deal will be treated as a purchase for accounting purposes.

"The addition of NORESCO to our portfolio is a part of ERI's strategy to expand our geographic market position with a total energy services product line," said Fred Abrew, president and chief executive officer of Equitable.

Abrew said the deal will strengthen Equitable's overall energy efficiency capabilities for customers throughout North and South America, creating a mass of public and private sector customers as well as earnings opportunities.

Equitable said that between the two companies, there is an estimated $350 million in awarded resource management contracts planned for fulfillment during the next three to five years with industrial, government and commercial customers.
As a part of Equitable, Northeast will keep its current management team and its brand name. Northeast is a Framingham, Mass.-based company.
